description: From Middle French national, corresponding to nation +‎ -al.

adjectives.description: national (comparative more national, superlative most national)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to a nation or country, especially as a whole; affecting, shared by, or existing throughout all of a nation. [from 16th c.]
Belonging to or characteristic of a specific nation or country, as opposed to others. [from 17th c.]

examples: ‘Come, come, don't deny it: they are really national. Why, now, the Adams are as liberal-minded men as any in the world: but, I don't know how it is, all their workmen are Scotch.’
The diplomats were advised not to interact with any foreign nationals except on official duty.

entries.meaning: (usually in the plural) A tournament in which participants from all over the nation compete.
examples: After winning the regional tournament, the team advanced to the nationals.

entries.meaning: (usually in the plural, journalism) A national newspaper.
